title: Hamas fighters share video of Israeli military camp
description:
Palestinian resistance group Hamas has released a video that they claim shows the interior of an Israeli military base.

In the early hours of October 7, Hamas fighters raided Israeli bases in the region under the cover of thousands of rockets, catching the Israeli security apparatus off guard.

Israeli army spokesman Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari stated that more than 2200 rockets have been fired into Israel since 03:30 GMT, according to the local news outlet Times of Israel.

Hagari also noted that Hamas fighters infiltrated from land, air and sea.
The Israeli army has announced military operations in response to an unprecedented military action by Hamas in blockaded Gaza, targeting Israel.

description:

Woman attacked for having Palestinian flag on her car in Canada
description:
“You should be raped and dragged through the streets in front of your kids.”

A Tunisian woman named Imane Najar was attacked by a woman in Montreal, Canada, on October 10 for having a Palestinian flag on her car. According to Najar, the woman, Lauren Wise, “rammed her car" into Najar's vehicle twice before fleeing. Najar filed a complaint with the police “to report and denounce the hate crime, threats, vandalism and the hit-and-run”.

title: How does von der Leyen’s stance on Ukrainian and Palestinian civillians differ?
description:

title: Video shows Israeli military stripping naked Palestinians in northern Gaza
description:
In scenes reminiscent of Nazi Germany, the Israeli military blindfolds and strips naked Palestinian civilians in northern Gaza’s Beit Lahia town, according to Euro-Med Human Rights Monitor.

The Geneva-based NGO says Israeli soldiers seized remaining residents of the town of Beit Lahia. Several Palestinians, who were taking refuge in two UN-affiliated schools, were beaten severely and forced to remove all their clothes except underwear.

A young man called Mohammed Al Rai told the Euro-Med Monitor team that he saw at least seven young men being shot dead by the Israeli forces in separate incidents, due to their refusal to comply with the humiliating orders of the Israeli army, the NGO says.

Diaa Al-Kahlot, a journalist working for Al Araby Al Jadeed, was among those seized, according to the NGO, which says several doctors, academics, journalists, and elderly have also been seized.

Several Israeli papers claimed that the footage showed Hamas suspects who had surrendered in Jabalia and other areas.

Osama Hamdan, a member of Hamas’s political bureau, however, denied that there had been mass arrests of the group’s members and denounced the “abuse of unarmed civilians who have nothing to do with military operations.”

TRT World could not independently verify the footage.

The Capitol police says it arrested 51 people who took part in the civil disobedience protest.

title: Polish far-right lawmaker extinguishes Hanukkah candle in parliament | DW Shorts
description:
A far-right lawmaker in the Polish parliament used a fire extinguisher to put out the candles on a menorah being lit in the parliament lobby for the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah.

All major political forces quickly condemned the incident by Grzegorz Braun and said there would be no tolerance for antisemitic and xenophobic behavior in the Sejm, the Polish parliament.

The speaker of the parliament, Szymon Holownia, called the act "absolutely scandalous" and excluded Braun from the day's parliamentary proceedings.

title: A call to journalists covering Palestine
description:
From using dehumanising language when describing Palestinians to firing reporters critical of Israel’s current and ongoing aggression, legacy media outlets are silencing the voices of journalists exposing Israeli state propaganda.

On Working Journalists’ Day, TRT World is hereby committing itself to serve as a platform for the stories that other media organisations reject — not because they lack journalistic quality, but rather due to editorial biases among these networks vis-a-vis Israel and its war on Palestine’s Gaza.

Please send us your stories here: pitch@trtworld.com

title: All CNN Gaza coverage subject to Israeli Military Censor oversight - report
description:

title: Iran strikes ‘Israeli spy’ facilities in Iraq
description:
Iran has fired ballistic missiles on “espionage headquarters of Israel’s Mossad” in Iraq and against “terrorist groups” affiliated with Daesh in neighbouring Syria, state media reported.

At least four civilians were killed and six wounded in the strikes on Iraq’s Erbil city, local authorities said.

The strikes come at a time of heightened tensions in the region and fears of a wider spillover of the ongoing Israel’s war in Gaza.

Since October 7 2023, Iran-backed militias in Iraq have launched near-daily drone attacks on bases housing foreign US forces, whereas Tehran threatens Israel on a daily basis over Gaza’s indiscriminate bombardment.

title: Indians jump at chance to work in Israel despite war | DW News
description:
Thousands in India rushed to sign up to work in Israel. Despite the conflict between Israel and Hamas the recruitment center was packed with people willing to work in a warzone. Most are driven by the high unemployment rate in India where 42% of university graduates under 25 are jobless.
Israel barred entry to Palestinians after Hamas' October 7 terror attack creating a deficit of nurses and construction workers. Last year Israel and India agreed to allow 40,000 Indians to work in these fields. They could earn up to five times more.

title: Joe Biden responds to attack that killed 3 US soldiers | DW News
description:
The United States says three of its troops have been killed and dozens more wounded in a drone attack near a base on Jordan's border with Syria.   US officials say the drone struck near a barracks at the base in the Rukban region. It's the first time a strike has killed American soldiers in the area since the start of the Israel-Hamas war. President Joe Biden blamed Iran-backed militants for the attack and vowed to respond. Iran denies any involvement.

title: How will UNRWA function as more donor countries cut funding
description:
The United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees -- UNRWA -- is a lifeline for nearly 6 million people.
Established in 1949, its mission is to provide relief to Palestinians forced from their homes when the state of Israel was created.
Now the agency's future  is under threat.
Several Western nations have suspended their funding to UNRWA in the wake of Israeli accusations that some staff members were involved in the attacks by Hamas on southern Israel in October.
The agency has dismissed some employees.
So, what impact will the aid suspension have on the Palestinian people ?

Qatar PM Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani spoke at an event hosted by the Atlantic Council in the US capital on Monday. 
Sheikh Mohammed spoke about the conflict between Israel and Hamas and the looming threat of a broader regional war, He outlined Doha’s role in current negotiations over the war in Gaza and Qatar’s strategic vision for de-escalating tensions and promoting regional security and prosperity in the Middle East. The Qatari PM also discussed the US-Qatar relations, Doha’s role in ensuring regional security, and Qatar’s foreign-policy vision.
Doha says intelligence officials from Egypt, Israel and the US are working to secure a Gaza truce and the release of captives.

title: What is the UNRWA? | DW News
description:
Israel has accused workers of the UNRWA of violence during the Hamas-led terror attack on October 7th. Many countries have stopped their funding.
But what is the UNRWA?

The UN agency provides education, healthcare and welfare support to people in Gaza, the West Bank, Jordan, Syria and Lebanon. It was specifically set up in 1949 to help Palestinian refugees displaced. For years, Israel has accused the UNRWA of failing to fully distance itself from designated terrorist groups such as Hamas. The suspension of funding by the top sources – the US, Germany and the EU - comes at the worst time. The UN’s agency is warning of an ‘unprecedented’ humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title: UNRWA employees preemptively dismissed #gaza #unrwa #unitednations
description:
UNRWA employees preemptively dismissed #gaza #unrwa #unitednations
Tamara Alrifai, a spokeswoman of the UN’s agency for Palestinian refugees, says while it dismissed nine of 12 UNRWA employees accused by Israel of taking part in the October 7 attacks, the move was made “preemptively” while investigations were under way.

“They were dismissed upon allegations preemptively. These now-former employees have the right of recourse in case the findings are in their favour,” Alrifai told Al Jazeera.

She noted Israel is aware of the identities of all its 13,000-member staff, emphasising the “sturdy recruitment” process and security checks carried out on each one.

“UNRWA shares the full list of names of its staff in Gaza, the West Bank, and East Jerusalem with Israel every year. So the list of our staff is known to the government of Israel. Host governments, including Israel, may come back to us with concerns over staff. We have not received concerns from the state of Israel upon their receiving these lists on an annual basis.”

title: Israel bombs Rafah, last ‘safe zone’ for Gaza civilians
description:
Israel war planes continue to strike Rafah in southern Gaza.

1.9 million Palestinians or 85% of the Gaza population took refuge in this city according to the UN. Located at the border with Egypt, Rafah was designated as a ‘safe zone’ by Israel last December.

But on Monday, Israel’s Defence Minister Yoav Gallant said that Rafah would be the army’s next target, claiming it is the last remaining stronghold of the Palestinian group Hamas.

Several rights groups have warned against any Israeli military offensive in Rafah, which could result in huge loss of lives.

“We can warn what might unfold with the ground invasion. Under international humanitarian law, indiscriminate bombing of densely populated areas may amount to war crimes,” the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), told a UN briefing in Geneva.

title: The roots of Lowkey's pro-Palestine activism
description:

Discover how Palestine symbolizes a cause embodying the complexities and contradictions of contemporary society, shaping Lowkey's trajectory as an influential voice in the struggle for justice and liberation.

title: Houthis destroy $30-million US drone flying over Yemen
description:
The Houthis destroy a $30-million US combat drone flying over Yemen after targeting two Western ships in the Gulf of Aden.

Confirming the destruction of a MQ-9 drone, the Pentagon said that “attacks are getting more sophisticated.”

In the last two days, the Houthis hit two ships which were identified as the “Sea Champion”, a Greek-flagged US-owned carrier and the “Rubymar”, a Belize-flagged UK-owned boat. The Rubymar was seriously damaged, its crew reportedly had to evacuate.

In response to the attacks and given the impact on the global economy, the EU said it is starting a “defensive mission” to protect Red Sea shipping from Houthi attacks.

But the Houthis said that the operations in the Red and Arabian seas will continue “until the aggression stops and the siege on the Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip is lifted.”

title: Jordan airdrops vital aid across besieged Gaza
description:
As Israel prepares to invade Rafah, Jordan airdrops crucial aid to besieged Palestinians who are facing famine-like situations. The Jordanian army carried out four air drops and delivered aid at 11 sites between the northern edge of Gaza and Rafah in the south.

Images filmed in Rafah showed some of the aid materials falling into the sea while some Palestinians embarked on boats to retrieve it.

The aid contains “relief and food supplies, including ready-made meals of high nutritional value,” Jordanian officials said. Jordan has conducted 16 airdrop operations since the beginning of Israel’s war on Gaza but this one was its biggest mission.

description:

title: 10 children have “starved to death” in Gaza - UN
description:
At least 10 children officially registered in hospitals in Northern Gaza “have starved to death” according to the UN health agency which said that the number “can be expected to be higher”.

Heart-wrenching footage, filmed in the neonatal unit of the Kamal Adwan Hospital, shows two babies wrapped in a shroud by health workers while their families are breaking into tears.

Seven other infants remain in critical conditions in this hospital. Because of the lack of infant formula and power outage, they are at risk of dying of malnutrition and dehydration, according the Palestinian Health ministry.

title: US conducted its first aid airdrop into besieged Gaza
description:
The US conducted its first aid airdrop into besieged Gaza in response to the escalating humanitarian crisis exacerbated by an Israeli siege and the killing of Palestinians queuing for food.

Displaced Palestinians contend that airdropped aid is insufficient and urge the opening of land borders with Egypt for truck deliveries.

US officials say the joint operation with the Royal Jordanian Air Force delivered over 38,000 meals to southwestern Gaza and the town of Mawasi where 576,000 people are on the brink of famine, according to the UN.

description:

At least 9,000 women have been killed by Israel since October 7, including an estimated 37 mothers each day, according to UN Women.

title: Protesters accuse NYT of manufacturing ‘consent for genocide’ in Gaza
description:
“Consent for genocide is manufactured here”

US police have arrested 124 pro-Palestine protesters who blocked the New York Times headquarters in Manhattan, New York, over its coverage of war waged by Israel on besieged Palestinians.

The Palestinian Youth Movement and Writers Against the War on Gaza, which co-organised the protest, said that activists interrupted the distribution of the daily after blocking one of its printing plants in Queens and occupied the lobby of headquarters while the chairman was giving his annual “State of the Times” address.

The grassroot movement accuses the newspaper of showing the “worst journalistic malpractices and most genocidal propaganda of the year”, calling readers to cancel their subscriptions with the “New York Crimes”.

“We receive criticism from each side. We are open to good-faith disagreement but firmly reject any assertion that our coverage displays bias,” the New York Times claimed in a statement shared with ABC.

The statement concluded with a message that they will not let critics or advocacy campaigns sway them from “independent reporting”.

title: Protesters try to block US warship en route to Middle East
description:

Several activists reportedly chained themselves to the gangway of the vessel.

The authorities refused to specify the exact destination of the vessel. But activists fear it might provide weapon supplies to the Israeli army.

According to the US Department of Defense, the ship is part of the “Navy’s Combat Logistics Force” and provides “fuel replenishment to Navy ships at sea”

title: Israel kills at least 5 foreign aid workers in Gaza
description:
Israel has killed at least five foreign volunteers with World Central Kitchen, a US-based aid group, in a new air strike on Gaza, local authorities said.

The Israeli military reportedly attacked a vehicle belonging to the charity, killing at least four members of the international relief team and their Palestinian driver. The team was killed after they delivered food in northern Gaza that arrived by a ship a few hours earlier from Cyprus.

Gaza’s government media office said the victims included British, Australian and Polish nationals.

title: Israeli spox Hagari offers 'deepest condolences' after killing of aid workers in Gaza
description:
Israeli military spokesman Daniel Hagari expressed the Israeli military's "deepest condolences" over what he described as a “serious incident” where seven aid workers of the World Central Kitchen were killed by air strikes in besieged Gaza on April 1. 

"As a professional military committed to international law, we are committed to examining our operations thoroughly and transparently," he added.

WCK has confirmed that Israel killed the workers hours after the group brought in a new shipload of food to distribute to Palestinians who been have pushed to the brink of starvation by Israel's brutal war.

title: US activists block entrance to arms manufacturer Lockheed Martin
description:
US activists block entrance to the factory of Lockheed Martin, the largest weapons manufacturer.

“Lockheed Martin supplies Israel with F-16 and F-35 fighter jets, Hellfire missiles, and other weapons and surveillance technology actively used in its ongoing air and ground assault on Gaza,” says Bay Area Palestine Solidarity group in a press release sent to TRT World.

Last year, Israel bought 25 F-35 fighter jets manufactured by Lackheed Martin, bringing the number of F-35s in Israel’s air force to 75. The deal was part of the defence package Israel receives from the United States.

Israel was the first country outside the United States to acquire the F-35. In May 2018 its air force chief said that Israel was the first to use the plane in combat.

title: Israel rejects UN talk to recognise Palestine as member
description:
“The UN is considering forcing the establishment of a Palestinian terrorist state. (...) It will be a Palestine-Nazi state”

As the UN Security Council is holding closed consultations to consider the recognition of Palestine as an official UN member state, Israeli ambassador Gilad Erdan criticises the UN and calls the initiative a “Palestine-Nazi terrorist state”

The UNSC president on Monday referred the Palestinian Authority’s application to become a full member of the world body to the committee on the admission of new members.

“We sincerely hope after 12 years since we change our status to an observer state, that the Security Council will elevate itself to implementing the global consensus on the two state solution by admitting the state of Palestine for full membership,” Palestinian UN envoy Riyad Mansour said, adding that a decision is expected to be taken on April 18 during a ministerial meeting on the Middle East.

title: Gaza twin amputees beg for rescue
description:
Gaza twins Refif and Refik Dagmus lost 11 family members and their limbs when their house was hit by an Israeli airstrike. Refif's foot and Refik's leg had to be amputated, and they now need to leave Gaza to receive further treatment.

UNICEF estimates that a thousand children in Gaza have become amputees since the war started.

Egeland also said he thought most people wanted to leave Gaza and predicted an exodus to Europe when the conflict ended.

title: GWU students refuse to clear Gaza encampment in Washington DC
description:
Georges Washington University students refuse to clear their Gaza encampment, located half a mile from the White House, despite multiple deadlines imposed by the administration in the past 36 hours.

“GW Police have put up barricades around the perimeter to prevent people from entering or exiting the yard. They woke students up twice last night to intimidate them,” the Student Coalition for Palestine at GWU said, adding some faculty members formed a human chain to protect them.

Students said the administration has threatened to suspend them if their protests against Israel’s war on Gaza continued.

Activists involved in the “Liberated zone” or “Popular University for Gaza at GWU” are demanding the university “drop the charges against pro-Palestine organisers, protect pro-Palestine speech on campus and divest from companies selling weapons to the zionist regime [Israel]“.

title: Students protest for Palestine during Michigan University commencement
description:
Pro-Palestine students at the University of Michigan protested for Palestine during their commencement ceremony by wearing the traditional keffiyeh scarves and waving Palestinian flags among a crowd of thousands at Michigan Stadium in Ann Arbor on May 4.

The ceremony proceeded despite the protest, with campus police guiding the protesters to the rear of the stadium. No arrests were reported, as confirmed by a university spokesperson.

title: Al Jazeera's office raided by Israeli police
description:
Following the Israeli government's decision to shut down Al Jazeera, Israeli police raided the office of the Qatar-owned media network in occupied East Jerusalem to confiscate their equipment.

Israel’s Knesset passed legislation last month allowing the Communications Minister the power to shut down foreign networks operating in Israel and confiscate their equipment if the Defence Minister identifies that their broadcast posed “an actual harm to the state’s security.”

Al Jazeera have since claimed that the move was a "criminal action" and the accusation that the network threatened Israeli security was a "dangerous and ridiculous lie".

title: Israel begins striking Rafah despite Hamas accepting truce deal
description:
Israeli army has launched multiple air strikes on Rafah, hours after Palestinian resistance group Hamas agreed to a ceasefire deal.

The latest bombardment was immediately condemned by neighbour Jordan whose top diplomat Ayman Safadi accused hawkish Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu of jeopardising the truce deal by bombing Rafah.

Amman also asked Israeli ally US to intervene and stop a “new massacre” in Rafah.

Ahead of the strikes, Israeli planes dropped leaflets threatening to invade eastern Rafah and demanding that civilians flee the area sheltering some 1.5 million Palestinians.

title: With no universities left in Gaza, student protests bring hope | The Take
description:
Student protests are resonating with Palestinians, who face the destruction of nearly all universities in Gaza. Palestinian university presidents signed an open letter saying the protests serve as a “beacon of hope.” We look at what has been lost and what remains.

In this episode: 

- Jehad Abusalim, Executive Director, The Jerusalem Fund
- Heigo Parsa, University of Toronto Student 
- Jasmine Al-Rawi, University of Sydney Student
- Sesek Duran, National Autonomous University of Mexico Student 
- Sundos Hammad, Right to Education Coordinator, Birzeit University 

Episode credits:

This episode was produced by Chloe K. Li and Ashish Malhotra with our host Malika Bilal. Catherine Nouhan fact-checked this episode.

Our sound designer is Alex Roldan. Our lead of audience development and engagement is Aya Elmileik and Adam Abou-Gad is our engagement producer.

Alexandra Locke is The Take’s executive producer. Ney Alvarez is Al Jazeera's head of audio.

title: Amsterdam University walkout: Staff protest after police crackdown
description:
Staff at universities across the Netherlands are staging a walkout.
It follows a violent police crackdown on pro-Palestinian protesters on Amsterdam University's campus 
last week. The students are demanding the university divests from Israel linked companies and are calling for a ceasefire in Gaza.

Al Jazeera’s Step Vaessen has more on the walkout from Amsterdam.

Professor of Sociology at the University of Amsterdam, Sarah Bracke, spoke to Al Jazeera about the student and staff protests against Israel’s war on Gaza in the Netherlands.

She said the staff at three higher education institutions in Amsterdam witnessed police “violently” attempting to disperse a peaceful student encampment last Monday.

She said the staff today are protesting as they want to end the university’s complicity in “the ongoing genocide” in Gaza, but also want to call out the violent methods that police have used to suppress peaceful protests.

She also noted that there were Jewish staff and student protesters beaten by police despite the educational institutions claiming that police are needed to protect the safety of Jewish students on campus.

title: Arrests as US police storm pro-Palestine protest at University of California, Irvine
description:
Police in the US have arrested students at an encampment at the University of California in Irvine in support of a ceasefire in Gaza.
Hundreds of students at the campus closed off a lecture hall on Wednesday.
The university is one of many colleges across the country where protesters have been demanding that schools divest from Israeli companies.

Students at the University of Florida in Gainesville have also been demonstrating against the war in Gaza.
That's despite the university's orders not to.

Al Jazeera’s Rob Reynolds has more from the University of California in Irvine and Alan Fisher is on the campus in Gainesville.

title: False images spread online about Iran president helicopter crash. #EbrahimRaisi #Iran #BBCNews
'Braverman is a War Criminal!': Activist slams ex-UK minister's support for Israel amid Gaza war
description:
Fiona Lally, an activist from the Revolutionary Communist Party who is coordinating multiple pro-Palestinian encampments across UK universities, has recently labelling Suella Braverman, a former home secretary, a war criminal. This accusation is following a televised encounter where Lally criticised Braverman's handling of pro-Palestinian rallies in the UK and condemned Israel's actions in Gaza, describing them as genocide and criminal enslavement. Lally is joining Al Jazeera from London, where she is emphasising the importance of exposing political hypocrisy and the widespread anger against establishment politics, asserting that movements like hers are crucial in challenging the capitalist system that prioritises profit over people. She is expressing that such movements if expanded and supported by workers through strikes and boycotts, have the power to bring down the current government. Lally highlights the international nature of this sentiment and the efforts of the Revolutionary Communist Party to organise globally, aiming to channel public discontent into a revolutionary movement.

Political scientist, Norman Finkelstein, says the US elections are often determined by Thomas A. Fergusons’s “Golden Rule”- that whichever candidate receives the most campaign contributions, wins the US presidential election. Finkelstein says that US President Joe Biden may have “fear” of losing the “Jewish billionaire” contributions, if he makes a “principled stance” in the Gaza war.

title: Ex-Zionist describes killing woman over her pro-Palestine views in South Africa
description:
A South African man from a prominent Jewish family has described why he stabbed to death a mother and wounded her husband and son in a suburb of Durban city. 

Grayson Beare, 44, who is charged with murder and two additional counts of attempted murder over the attack, which took place on Sunday, says he attacked the family for their pro-Palestine views, according to local media and a viral video.

The video on social media from what appears to be a waiting area of the Durban Magistrates Court shows the suspect being questioned by someone off camera where Beare says he used a knife to attack Halima Hoosen-Preston and critically wound her husband and 14-year-old son.

Detectives initially said the motive of the violence was not clear.

But a 10-year-old survivor — understood to be the woman’s daughter — told investigators that “the suspect stated that he was stabbing them because they supported Palestine.

”Beare is the son of the chairperson of both Beare Holdings and the South African Holocaust and Genocide Foundation Julian Beare. 

The Beare family sought to distance themselves from their relative, saying. “We totally reject any association with what he [Beare] said and what he has done.”

title: Israeli Zionists storm Al Aqsa Mosque compound
description:
Under heavy police protection, hundreds of Israeli settlers assault Palestinians and storm Al Aqsa Mosque complex.

On so-called “Jerusalem Day”, extremist Israeli groups and fanatic Zionist settlers celebrate Israel’s illegal occupation of East Jerusalem in 1967.
Participants in the march typically wave Israeli flags, spit on Muslim and Christian residents and chant genocidal slogans such as “Death to Arabs”, “Every Arab is a terrorist” and “Burn their village.”

Palestinians see the march as a blatant provocation aimed at erasing the Islamic, Arab identity of Jerusalem and undermining their claim to East Jerusalem as the capital of independent Palestine.

Hamas resistance group says the Zionist march “confirms the occupation approach to Judaise the (Jerusalem) sanctities.”

This year, several members of the Israeli extremist government took part in the march, there were reports of desecration of Muslim graves in the Bab Al-Rahma cemetery and Palestinian journalist Saif Kwasmi was assaulted.

title: Israel blocking hundreds of aid trucks as Gaza starves
description:
Blockade of humanitarian aid by Israel is causing starvation deaths in besieged Gaza.

More than 2,000 trucks carrying humanitarian aid and commercial goods are stuck on the Egyptian side of the Rafah border crossing, the EU aid officials say, demanding a “sustained, unimpeded, and safe humanitarian access.”

Meanwhile, many people in Gaza are currently facing “catastrophic hunger and famine-like conditions”, according to WHO.

“Despite reports of increased delivery of food, there is currently no evidence that those who need it most are receiving sufficient quantity and quality of food,” the UN agency says, adding that more than 8,000 children under 5 have already been diagnosed and treated for acute malnutrition.

Multiple countries and aid organisations have accused Israel of using starvation as a weapon of war against Palestinians of Gaza.

The incident occurred during an altercation between Palestinians and four armed men — an Israeli soldier, two off-duty reservists and a civilian — according to Israeli police.

title: Pro-Palestine demonstrators take to the streets in Canada
description:
Thousands of pro-Palestinian demonstrators in Canada took part in rallies across Toronto and Montreal, carrying banners and chanting pro-Palestine slogans.

Protesters called for an end to Israel's brutal invasion of Palestine’s Gaza, which is now in its 261st day and has claimed the lives of over 37,500 Palestinians and wounded more than 85,900.

description:

title: Gunmen launch attacks in two cities in Russia's Dagestan region | DW News
description:
Devastating attacks by gunmen across two cities in the Russian Caucasus region of Dagestan have killed more than a dozen police officers plus several civilians. There remains no immediate claim of responsibility for the terror that targeted houses of worship, including one synagogue and two churches. The synagogue is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

title: Excerpts from 'The Night Won't End: Biden's War on Gaza' | #AJShorts
description:
Watch the full documentary: https://youtu.be/ECFpW5zoFXA

As Israel’s bombing campaign continues in Gaza and the humanitarian crisis deepens to catastrophic levels, the Biden administration has not wavered in its support for Israel.

United States weapons transfers - from 2,000-pound bombs to artillery shells and tanks - have been a crucial part of the Israeli military campaign.

Fault Lines worked with journalists in Gaza to profile three families as they try to survive the war.

Together with Airwars, Fault Lines also investigated an air strike on December 11 in north Gaza in which more than 100 people from the same family were killed.

Numerous attacks on civilians - including that on Hind Rajab and her relatives in late January - have raised international concern and questions over continuing US support.

Fault Lines partnered with Forensic Architecture and Earshot to investigate that attack.

From air strikes to field executions, Fault Lines investigates the killings of civilians by the Israeli military in Gaza and the role of the United States in the war.

title: US lawmakers applaud Netanyahu amid Israel’s onslaught in Gaza
description:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu received several standing ovations during his address to a joint session of the US Congress on Wednesday, July 24. Meanwhile, Gaza's Nuseirat refugee camp, one of the enclave’s most densely populated areas, faced intense Israeli air strikes.

The Nuseirat refugee camp, which houses 250,000 residents and displaced people, has been bombarded 63 times in a week by the Israeli army, killing at least 91 Palestinians and injuring 251 others.

Israel’s war on Gaza, now in its 293rd day, has killed at least 39,175 Palestinians and wounded 90,403 others, with over 10,000 estimated to be buried under the debris.

title: Satellite images show water infrastructure before and after strikes in Rafah
description:
Recent satellite images have shown the destruction of water infrastructure in Rafah after the Israeli military attacked the wells in the city.

Salama Shurab, Head of the water networks at Khan Younis municipality, reported that Israeli forces destroyed the wells in Rafah and Khan Younis between July 18-27, blowing up more than 30 wells.

Palestinians were already enduring a severe water crisis and shortages of food, fuel and medicine, which have only worsened the suffering caused by Israel's onslaught on Gaza, now in its tenth month.

Amid scarcity, people in Gaza have turned to digging wells in desolate areas near the sea, where bombings have driven them, or rely on salty tap water from Gaza's only aquifer, now contaminated with seawater and sewage.

Children walk long distances to gather water from makeshift collection points. Too weak to carry the heavy containers, they often drag them home on wooden boards.

According to Oxfam, Gaza has lost nearly all its water production capacity, with 88% of its wells and all of its desalination plants damaged or destroyed.

title: Houthi video shows attack on ‘Israel-bound’ ship in solidarity with Gaza
description:
Yemen’s Houthi group has released footage showing them attacking a Greek-flagged oil tanker in the southern Red Sea earlier this week.

The tanker’s 25-person crew was rescued by an EU naval mission on Wednesday after abandoning ship, said the British military.

The tanker was carrying over 150,000 tonnes of crude oil from Iraq to Greece when it was attacked.

The ship is currently abandoned and on fire, approximately 77 nautical miles off the coast of Yemen.

The Red Sea is one of the world’s most frequently used sea routes for oil and fuel shipments.

The Houthis have been targeting Israel-bound cargo ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden in solidarity with Gaza, which has been under an Israeli genocidal war since October last year.

description:

Halimy’s “Tent Life” videos used to garner millions of views as he documented life under Israeli bombardment in a refugee camp.

He launched his TikTok account after being displaced with his parents, four brothers, and sister in Muwasi, the southern coastal area Israel designated as a so-called safe zone.

They had already been displaced and fled several times from Israel's deadly invasion, from Gaza City to Khan Younis, before escaping again for Muwasi.

title: Jenin mayor compares Israeli raid to ‘earthquake’ amid $135M in damages
description:
“The ongoing Israeli military operation in Jenin resembles an ‘earthquake,’ causing an estimated $135.2 million in damage so far,” said Jenin Mayor Nidal al Obaidi in an interview with Anadolu.

“The greatest loss is the lives of the martyrs,” Obaidi continued. “Materially, the destruction is immense, including the damage to infrastructure like water and communication lines and the targeting of electricity transformers.”

“The Israeli army is deliberately sabotaging and destroying the city,” Obaidi noted, emphasising that the offensive, now in its fifth day, continues to bring new destruction each day.

title: UK protesters spray red paint on pro-Israel lobby group
description:
A group of UK activists spray red paint and chain themselves to APCO Worldwide, claiming the company is “a political lobbyist for Israel’s largest weapons firm, Elbit Systems.”

“These lobbyists, including those who have previously secured back-door contracts for Elbit in the past, are working to shore up British support for Israel’s arms trade at a time when 16 activists are imprisoned for conscientious action taken against genocide,” the Palestine Action group said in a statement to TRT World.

“While the British state’s continued arms exports to Israel stands in violation of its own arms-export regulations, and in contravention of international obligations under the Genocide Convention and Arms Trade Treaty, such action is a necessity.”

title: Pro-Palestinian anti-war demonstration outside Melbourne arms expo
description:
Hundreds of pro-Palestinian anti-war protesters gathered outside the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre to protest the Land Forces International Land Defence Exposition.

Police and riot squads intervened violently against the protesters, using tear gas, rubber bullets and PAVA powder, a synthetic compound similar to capsicum or pepper spray that is dispensed from a can in liquid form. Greens MP Gabrielle de Vietri who attended the protest called the police response "disgusting" and "uncalled for."

title: Israeli claims of accidentally shooting Turkish American activist challenged
description:
A new investigation by The Washington Post has challenged Israel’s claims that it accidentally shot and killed Turkish American activist Aysenur Ezgi Eygi.

The 26-year-old activist succumbed to her wounds after being shot and critically injured in the head by Israeli forces in Beita, a town located south of Nablus in the occupied West Bank.

An autopsy on September 9 confirmed she was killed by a bullet to the head.
Israel claimed its forces “indirectly and unintentionally” shot her during a “violent riot,” however, the Post’s investigation has challenged these claims.

Here is what the investigation found.

The move marked the first time Israel has ever shuttered a foreign news outlet's operations.

title: Israel, Hezbollah trade cross-border strikes | DW News
description:
The Israeli military’s strikes into southern Lebanon this weekend mark some of the heaviest bombardment in 11 months of fighting. As the cross-border exchanges intensify, so do growing fears of all-out war. On Friday, an Israeli airstrike targeting Hezbollah commanders killed 45 people in a suburb of Beirut. On Sunday, heavy damages were reported and three wounded in the northern Israeli city of Kiryat Bialik, one of several civilian sites where Hezbollah rockets hit.

title: ‘Netanyahu, a war criminal, is speaking at the UN’
description:
“The United Nations should be ashamed of itself. They’ve let their own staff down.”

Writer and activist Ashish Prashar blames the UN for allowing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to speak at the General Assembly.

He tells TRT World that Netanyahu is a “war criminal who has targeted hundreds of United Nations employees” in Gaza, Lebanon and the occupied West Bank.

Since the beginning of Israel’s war on Gaza, nearly 300 humanitarian aid workers, more than two-thirds of them UN staff, have been killed.

title: Israeli troops getting ready for ground invasion of Lebanon
description:
Israel releases footage of its troops and tanks gathered at the Northern border before announcing a “limited, localised” ground invasion in Lebanon, targeting for now  “villages close to the border”.

“Operation ‘Northern Arrows’ will continue according to the situational assessment and in parallel to combat in Gaza and in other arenas,” the Israeli army said on X. “These operations were approved and carried out in accordance with the decision of the political echelon.”

This ground incursion into Lebanon, a sovereign state, is in violation of international law, and comes just days following the assassination of Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah and consecutive days of shelling throughout Beirut and southern Lebanese villages.

Israel killed over 1,000 people in Lebanon in recent weeks, wounding some other 6,000 people.

title: Beirut flights canceled after Israeli strike near airport
description:
Israel targets surrounding Beirut airport, provoking the cancellation of dozens of flights departing from Lebanon.

Explosions were heard and smoke could be seen rising a few hundred meters from the takeoff runaways, according to witnesses.

Without providing any proof, Israel’s army has shared video of the strikes, saying it was targeting Hezbollah missile launchers.

Earlier last week, Israel reportedly hacked the control tower of the airport, preventing an Iranian plane from landing.

title: Israel repeatedly strikes centre of Beirut, near airport
description:
The Israeli military has bombarded Beirut with 10+ consecutive air strikes, in one of its largest bombardment since the start of its aggression on Lebanon two weeks ago and its ground invasion a week ago.

Israel has killed nearly 2,000 people in Lebanon and uprooted over a million since October 8, 2023, a day after Hamas fighters raided Israeli military sites and settlements that were once Arab farms and villages.

But, at the same time, the Hezbollah group has been able to push back Israeli invaders in the south of the country, killing nearly 20 Israeli troops during their abortive infiltration attempts.

title: Israeli Children’s book calls for invasion of Lebanon
description:
Israeli father reads a children’s book named “Alon and Lebanon” to his young son, where the characters say that Lebanon “belongs to Israel”.

According to Israeli newspaper Haaretz, this new book - which openly calls for the invasion of Lebanon - was “crowd-funded” and “promoted” by a group of far-right Israeli settlers named “Wake Up North”, which includes Daniella Weiss.

“The movement’s leaders are clearly planning ahead, planting the seeds of longing for Lebanon in the hearts of young readers,” Haaretz says, adding that the book is for children aged 2-6.

title: Uprooted Palestinian olive trees regrow as symbol of resistance
description:
Since 1967, more than 800,000 olive trees, many of them centuries-old, have been illegally uprooted by Israeli authorities and settlers in the occupied Palestinian territories. 

Today, olive trees have become a symbol of Palestinian resistance

title: Funeral held for Palestinian man killed in occupied West Bank | Al Jazeera Newsfeed
description:
Residents in the occupied West Bank held a funeral for Ziad Abu Hlail, a 66-year-old Palestinian man who died during an Israeli raid to arrest one of his sons. A different son said Israeli forces struck and pushed the man. Abu Hlail was a prominent figure often seen in social media videos confronting Israeli soldiers.

title: American Muslims pray in New York to mark October 7
description:
American Muslims gather in New York's Union Square on the afternoon of 7 October for a special prayer event to honour the thousands of innocent lives lost in Palestine and Lebanon over the past year as a result of Israel's ongoing attacks.
